channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2024070941
item.description:
Report X-2024070941

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: QA got called to door 211 at 4:30pm by James the area manager for a leaking box. QA brought a leaker tote and gloves and brought it back to QA area with further inspection found that it was an undeclared hazmat when opening the box. QA quickly started the hazmat process and contained it in a salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024070702
item.description:
Report X-2024070702

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-08
  • City: HOLBROOK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The box looked like it may have been leaked on in the AM sort. The cardboard was dry but looked like it had been wet. The admin on duty opened the box and saw a cap to the one container looked like it was loose. He tightened the cap. The he repacked the containers since it was not definite that anything had leaked out from the loose cap. He secured all the caps. The box made it out for delivery but the customer refused the delivery since it had been repacked.

item.title: Report X-2024070709
item.description:
Report X-2024070709

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-08
  • City: BETHPAGE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill was discovered on the bottom of trailer 825073 during inbound sort. Justin Schmaeling (9205130) contained material inside of salvage drum. No other employees were exposed to the material. No ill affects reported by any employees. Schmaeling Followed FX Ground Procedure for Local Cleanup properly

item.title: Report X-2024070700
item.description:
Report X-2024070700

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-06
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: I FOUND THE HAZMAT ON THE UNLOAD SIDE OF THE BUILDING ON A CART IN A TOTE BECAUSE THE HAZMAT WAS LEAKING. I NOTICED THAT THE HAZMAT HAD A RELABLE LABEL ON IT BUT IT IS LABELED HAZ. NO OTHER PAPERWORK OR HAZMAT LABELS ON IT. I TOOK IT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AND FOUND THAT YES, THE HAZMAT IS LEAKING DUE TO LOOSE CAPS AND THE CAP WAS OFF THE 1-GAL JUG OF DEGREASER.
